example_takeaways: Make a bullet point list of key takeaways from this project.
example_best_practices: What are the best practices for [Activity or Process] in [Context or Field]?
example_explain_concept: Can you explain the concept of [Specific Concept] in simple terms?
start_conversation_or_examples: Start a conversation below or try these examples

homepage.projects_description: These are projects you've created, or where you are an admin.
homepage.no_projects_yet: You haven't created any projects yet. Let's

documents.enabled_tooltip: If a document is included in ANY enabled group, it will be included in chatbot results. Enabled groups take precedence over disabled groups.

models.more_details_about_ai_models: More details about the AI models
models.ncsa_hosted_description: The best free option is the Qwen 2 72B model, hosted by NCSA.
models.openai_description: OpenAI model details and pricing. An OpenAI API key is required, and you may face rate-limit issues until you complete your first billing cycle.
models.azure_openai_description: Azure OpenAI Service provides enterprise-grade security and regional availability. Check out Azure OpenAI models for details on available models and features.
models.anthropic_description: Access Claude models through Anthropic's API. Claude excels at complex reasoning and analysis tasks.
models.ollama_description: Run various open-source models locally through Ollama. Supports models like Llama 2, Mistral, and more with OpenAI-compatible API.
models.webllm_description: We support running some models in your web browser on your device. That's 100% local, on-device AI. It even uses your GPU. For this, your browser must pass this compatability check for WebGPU.
models.webllm_working: If you see lots of text, it's working. If you see "webgpu not available on this browser", it's not working.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.document_groups_description: Document Groups help you organize and control your documents. You can enable or disable specific document groups
dashboard.starting_url_web_scraping: The Starting URL of Web Scraping

upload_cards.website_description: Import content from any website by providing the URL. Supports recursive crawling with customizable depth.
upload_cards.github_description: Import content from GitHub repositories, including documentation, code, and README files.
upload_cards.mit_course_description: Import content from MIT OpenCourseWare, including lecture notes, assignments, and course materials.
upload_cards.coursera_description: Import content from Coursera courses, including lectures, assignments, and course materials.

web_scrape_refresh_notice: Page refreshes upon completion. Your documents stay safe even if you navigate away.
max_urls_tooltip: We will attempt to visit this number of pages, but not all will be scraped if they're duplicates, broken or otherwise inaccessible.
describe_project_placeholder: Describe your project, goals, expected impact etc...
shown_before_first_chat: Shown before users send their first chat.
greeting_placeholder: Enter a greeting to help users get started with your bot
users_try_example_questions: Users will likely try these first to get a feel for your bot.
logo_header_notice: This logo will appear in the header of the chat page.
all_selected_docs_added: All selected documents will be added to the group
must_sign_in_to_edit: You must sign in to create or edit content.
cannot_edit_gpt4_page: You cannot edit the gpt4 page.
gpt4_page_info: It's for using GPT-4 by itself with no extra knowledge base.
what_do_you_want_to_achieve: What do you want to achieve?
project_name_taken: This project name is already taken!
import_canvas_description: Import content directly from your Canvas course, including assignments, discussions, files, and more.
canvas_permission_instructions: Before proceeding, you MUST add the UIUC Chatbot as a student to your Canvas course at
canvas_permission_note: This is required for access to any of your Canvas content. The AI can only see what students/TAs have access to.
enter_canvas_url: Enter your Canvas course URL, it should look like
rebrand_announcement: Heads up: we've rebranded to Illinois Chat
rebrand_tooltip: We're on our way to becoming a production service for all U of I campuses.
deep_search_docs: Deep search your documents, build an AI-teaching assistant, accelerate your literature review,
equal_and_below_desc: Only scrape content that starts with the given URL. E.g. nasa.gov/blogs will scrape all blogs like nasa.gov/blogs/new-rocket but never go to nasa.gov/events.
same_subdomain_desc: Crawl the entire subdomain. E.g. docs.nasa.gov will grab that entire subdomain, but not nasa.gov or api.nasa.gov.
entire_domain_desc: Crawl as much of this entire website as possible. E.g. nasa.gov also includes docs.nasa.gov.
all_desc: Start on the given URL and wander the web...
suggest_equal_and_below: I suggest starting with Equal and Below
rerun_if_needed: then just re-run this if you need more later.
account_bug_message: You've encountered a software bug! Your account has no email address. Please shoot me an email so I can fix it for you:
prompt_creation_insights: For additional insights and best practices on prompt creation, please review:
openai_prompt_guide: The Official OpenAI Prompt Engineering Guide
system_prompt_description: The System Prompt provides the foundation for every conversation in this project. It defines the model's role, tone, and behavior. Consider including:
smart_document_search_tooltip: When enabled, UIUC.chat optimizes your queries to better search through course materials and find relevant content. Note: This only affects how documents are searched - your chat messages remain exactly as you write them.
guided_learning_tooltip: When enabled course-wide, this setting applies to all students and cannot be disabled by them. The AI will encourage independent problem-solving by providing hints and questions instead of direct answers, while still finding and citing relevant course materials. This promotes critical thinking while ensuring students have access to proper resources.
document_based_references_only_tooltip: Restricts the AI to use only information from the provided documents. Useful for maintaining accuracy in fields like legal research where external knowledge could be problematic.
bypass_internal_prompting_tooltip: Internally, we prompt the model to (1) add citations and (2) always be as helpful as possible. You can bypass this for full un-modified control over your bot.
copy_internal_prompt_tooltip: You can use and customize our default internal prompting to suit your needs. Note, only the specific citation formatting described will work with our citation 'find and replace' system. This provides a solid starting point for defining AI behavior in raw prompt mode.
reset_prompting_settings_confirm: Are you sure you want to reset your system prompt and all behavior settings to their default values?
restore_system_prompt_default: Restore the system prompt to the default template
disable_guided_learning_and_custom: Disable Guided Learning, Document-Only mode, and other custom settings
cannot_be_undone_confirm: This cannot be undone. Please confirm you wish to proceed.
retrieval_only_tooltip: Retrieval Only bypasses the LLM call, making it free to retrieve relevant documents that match your prompt.
configure_llm_providers: Configure LLM Providers for your Chatbot
configure_llms_helper: Configure which LLMs are available to your users. Enable or disable models to balance price and performance.
closed_source_llms_helper: The best performers, but you gotta pay their prices and follow their rules.
default_model_helper: Choose the default model for your chatbot. Users can still override this default to use any of the models enabled on the left.
ollama_helper_text: Ollama allows you to easily self-host LLMs. Set up Ollama on your machine and provide the base URL. Note that only the following models are supported, email us if you'd like any others: llama3.1:8b, llama3.1:70b, llama3.1:405b.
ncsa_hosted_llms_helper_text: These models are hosted by the Center for AI Innovation at the National Center for Supercomputing Applications. They're free.
ncsa_hosted_vlms_helper_text: Vision Language Models hosted by NCSA. These models can understand and analyze images in addition to text. Free for UIUC students.
webllm_helper_text: WebLLM is a framework for building and deploying LLMs in the browser.
dropzone_reject: Upload rejected, not proper file type or too large.
dropzone_idle_project_name: Enter an available project name above! üëÄ
dropzone_drag_helper: Drag'n'drop files or a whole folder here
note_ncsa_models: NCSA hosted models like Qwen and Llama are hosted by NCSA and they are free!
note_gpt4o_mini: GPT-4o-mini offers the best price/performance ratio
note_llm_keys: UIUC.chat automatically manages LLM provider keys - just add them in the LLMs page.
note_rag_results: For getting only RAG results, set retrieval_only to true. This will not invoke the LLM.
coursera_ingest_alert: Coursera ingest is not yet implemented. Please check back later.
coursera_ingest_helper: Import content from Coursera courses, including lectures, assignments, and course materials.
coursera_ingest_instructions_1: For Coursera, just enter a URL like
disclaimer_full:
IMPORTANT: PLEASE READ THIS DISCLAIMER CAREFULLY BEFORE UTILIZING THIS AI-POWERED CHATBOT ("Chatbot") DEVELOPED BY THE CENTER FOR AI INNOVATION AT THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR SUPERCOMPUTING APPLICATIONS (NCSA) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS URBANA CHAMPAIGN. THE APPLICATION IS OWNED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS ("University, we, us, or our"). YOUR ACCESS AND USE OF THE CHATBOT CONSTITUTES YOUR ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND ACCEPTANCE OF THE TERMS OF THIS DISCLAIMER.

1. FOR GENERAL INFORMATION PURPOSES ONLY: The Chatbot is designed to provide general information based on the materials used at the time of its creation. The information provided by the Chatbot is not intended to replace or substitute for any professional, academic, or other analysis. 
2. NO GUARANTEE OF ACCURACY: University endeavors to ensure that the information provided by the Chatbot is accurate. However, University does not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or relevance of the information provided. The information may not reflect the most recent updates or changes.
3. INFORMATION GATHERING AND POTENTIAL INACCURACY: The Chatbot uses the provided materials to offer general guidance. Despite our efforts to ensure accuracy, we cannot guarantee the precision, completeness, or current relevance of the information contained in the guidance. The Chatbot may occasionally provide information that is inaccurate or outdated. We strongly recommend that you cross-verify any information provided by the Chatbot with the actual material sources before making any decisions or taking any actions based on the information received.
4. FEEDBACK AND REPORTING INACCURACIES: We encourage you to provide us feedback on your use of Chatbot and to notify us of any inaccuracies by emailing us at rohan13@illinois.edu.
5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY: Under no circumstances shall University be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, data, or other intangible losses resulting from the use of or inability to use the Chatbot. 
6. INDEMNIFICATION: You agree to indemnify and hold University (including its trustees, fellows, officers, employees, students, and agents) harmless from any claim or demand, including reasonable attorneys‚Äô fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of your use of the Chatbot, your violation of this disclaimer, or your violation of any rights of another. 
7. NO WARRANTIES: The Chatbot is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. University expressly disclaims all warranties of any kind, whether express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. 
8. THIRD-PARTY LINKS: The Chatbot may contain links to third-party websites or services that are not owned or controlled by University. University has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party websites or services. 
9. GOVERNING LAW: This Disclaimer and any dispute arising out of or related to it is governed and interpreted under the laws of the State of Illinois, excluding its conflict of laws provisions.
10. Jurisdiction. You agree that all actions or proceedings arising out of or related to your use of Chatbot shall be litigated in courts located within the State of Illinois. All claims against University must be filed in accordance with the Illinois Court of Claims Act. You: (a) consents and submits to the jurisdiction of any state court located within Illinois and (b) shall not bring any action or claim against University in any other jurisdiction.

BY USING THE CHATBOT, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE TO THIS DISCLAIMER AND ITS TERMS. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH ANY PART OF THIS DISCLAIMER, STOP USING THE CHATBOT. WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO MODIFY OR UPDATE THIS DISCLAIMER AT ANY TIME WITHOUT PRIOR NOTICE. YOUR CONTINUED USE OF THE CHATBOT FOLLOWING ANY CHANGES CONSTITUTES YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE REVISED DISCLAIMER.
cropwizard_licenses_body: The documents in CropWizard are collected from many different sources, and each document is subject to its respective license, including the following. Any downstream use of CropWizard's results must respect the license of the documents that were used.
cropwizard_license_disclaimer: CropWizard's document corpus is subject to {licenses}. Usage is subject to {terms}, a {privacy_policy}, and {ai_policy}. Sorry, the legal team made us say that.
cannot_edit_course: You cannot edit this page because you don't own it.
sign_in_or_new_page: Either sign in with a different account (in the top right) or Go to {new_page_link} to make a new page.
email_creator_admins: Email the creator or admins to request access:
visualization_not_available_body: We need at least 20 questions to generate a meaningful visualization of how topics relate to each other. Please ask more questions and check back later!
learn_more_semantic: Learn more about semantic similarity visualizations

homepage_easiest_way: It's the easiest way to make your own Chatbot
homepage_step1_desc1: Simply Drag-n-Drop your files for analysis.
homepage_step1_desc2: Connect to Canvas, GitHub, Notion and more.
homepage_step1_desc3: Web crawl your favorite articles and blogs.
homepage_step2_desc: Updated with the world's best AI models at your fingertips, enhanced with tools and advanced prompt engineering.
homepage_api_pitch: If you're tired of the OpenAI API and want an AI that's trained to understand your data, come build on our API with 52+ models to choose from. We're always updated with the latest State of the Art (SOTA) open source LLMs for free, hosted here at Illinois.
homepage_industry_pitch: We build features for industry partners to bring GenAI to their org. Reach out at hi@uiuc.chat
homepage_dive_right_into_bots: Dive right into our bots trained on everything Illinois
homepage_its_the_easiest_way_to_make_you: It's the easiest way to make your
homepage_to_canvas_github_notion: to Canvas, GitHub, Notion and more.
homepage_for_whoever_you_want_to_use_it: for whoever you want to use it

homepage_started_by_rohan_marwaha: Started by Rohan Marwaha at the University of Illinois. But it
flagship_research_tagline: Find professors based on your research interests
flagship_research_description: Using all of Illinois's documentation, get detailed examples, advice and information about the conference.

flagship_neurips2024_description: Using all of NeurIPS 2024's documentation, get detailed examples, advice and information about the conference.

flagship_ncsadelta_description: Using all of Delta's documentation, get detailed examples, advice and information about how to use the Delta supercomputer.

analysis.metaDescription: The AI teaching assistant built for students at UIUC.
analysis.projectAnalyticsDesc: Overview of project engagement and usage statistics
analysis.userEngagementDesc: Detailed breakdown of user interaction patterns
analysis.selectTimeRange: Select a time range to filter the visualizations below
analysis.noConversationData: No conversation data available for selected time range
analysis.tryDifferentTimeRange: Try selecting a different time range to view the visualizations
analysis.aiModelsUsed: Distribution of AI models used across all conversations
analysis.showsTotalConversations: Shows the total number of conversations that occurred on each calendar day
analysis.viewConversationPatterns: View conversation patterns by hour of day or day of week
analysis.heatmapConversationDensity: A heatmap showing conversation density across both days and hours

analysis.switchLinearLog: Switch between linear and logarithmic scale visualization

default_system_prompt: You are a helpful AI assistant. Follow instructions carefully. Respond using markdown.

tools.metaDescription: The AI teaching assistant built for students at UIUC.
tools.visualEditor: beautiful visual workflow editor to create custom functions for your project.
tools.inviteOnly: Tool use via LLMs is invite-only to prevent abuse. Please shoot me an email for access: rohan13@illinois.edu
tools.createApiKey: Inside n8n, create an n8n API key and save it here.
tools.startWorkflow: Start by creating your first workflow on
tools.ensureTrigger: Ensure you have the correct trigger node for your workflow, check docs for details
tools.addNodes: Add the necessary nodes for your workflow
tools.makeActive: Make sure your workflow is active
tools.testWorkflow: Test your workflow to complete usage onboarding
tools.workflowCongrats: If your workflow is working as expected, Congrats! üöÄ
tools.usersCanUse: Your users can now start using it on the
tools.apiKeyDescription: We use this to run your workflows. You can find your n8n API Key in your n8n account settings.
tools.apiKeyPlaceholder: Enter your n8n API Key here
tools.api_stateless_info: This API is stateless, meaning each request is independent of others. For multi-turn conversations, simply append new messages to the 'messages' array in the next call.
